title: Understanding the Problem
text: We need to estimate the height of the building using the information from two positions where the students observe the angle of elevation to the top of the building. The two observations form two right triangles, each with the same height for the building, but different distances from the building. This suggests we can use trigonometric functions, specifically the tangent function, to find the height of the building.

title: Solving for Height
text: We are given an angle of 39° and a distance of $$x$$ from the building in the first observation. Using the tangent function, the equation is: $$tan(39\degree)=\frac{h}{x}$$. Now rearrange this equation to solve for height.

title: Solve for Height
text: The students move $$300$$ feet closer to the building, so the new distance from the building is $$x-300$$, and the angle of elevation is 50°. Using the tangent function again, the equation is: $$tan(50\degree)=\frac{h}{x-300}$$. Rearrage this to solve for height.

title: Find $$x$$
text: Now, set the two expressions for height $$h$$ equal to each other and solve for $$x$$.
